description: The Microsoft Word 2016 show helps a viewer to have a fundamental understanding of the Word 2016 environment and the ability to complete tasks independently.  The show demonstrates the correct application of the principal features of Word 2016.  Viewing all the episodes should help viewers to create and edit basic documents  for a variety of purposes and situations.  This should help someone who might be a student, clerical worker, IT support staff as well as someone seeking the Microsoft Office Specialist Certification.
name: Word 2016 - Level 1
subtitle: Word Processing Application

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike look at getting started using Microsoft Office Word 2016. They look at different ways to launch Word, like pinning to the taskbar and desktop shortcuts. They also look at launching Word in safe mode if Word won't launch normally. They explore some of the options in Word, like the quick access toolbar.
episodes.title: Getting Started

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue to look at getting started with Word. They explore the interface, including the ribbons, contextual tabs, and keyboard shortcuts. They look at interface features like galleries and live preview, the mini toolbar, and dialog box launchers. They also explore task panes and the status bar.
episodes.title: Getting Started Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike look at how to create and manage documents in Word 2016. They show how to create a new blank document, as well as explore Microsoft's collection of online templates. They talk about compatibility with previous versions of Word, as well as opening and working with non-native file formats.
episodes.title: Creating a Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike look at ways to navigate through a document. They start with different ways to select text. Then they demonstrate how to use the find and replace options.
episodes.title: Navigate a Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike demonstrate how to apply formatting to a document. They use Page Setup to adjust the margins of a document. They apply styles to elements within a document, and themes that apply to the entire document. They create and add headers and footers to a document, as well as page numbers. They also show how to add a watermark to a document.
episodes.title: Format a Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike explore the different document views available in Word, including reading, print, web, outline and draft. Then they show how to customize the quick access toolbar as well as customizing the ribbons. They also show how to view different parts of a document at the same time using split view. They finish the show with a look at macros and demonstrate recording a simple macro.
episodes.title: Customize Options and Views

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike demonstrate printing a document. They look at the print preview feature, and the different options available when printing. They show how to print an entire document or just part of a document. They also show how to scale a document to print on different size paper. Then they demonstrate how to password protect and share a document.
episodes.title: Print or Save a Document

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes demonstrate how to control the look of your Word documents. They look at preventing widowed and orphaned lines from adding themselves to extra pages. They talk about how to separate blocks of text into sections as well as using columns to adjust the appearance of the text. They will explore how to insert page breaks into the document to make sure that paragraphs are kept in order and not separated into different pages of the Word document.
episodes.title: Order and Group Paragraphs

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes dive into the creating tables inside of a Microsoft Word document. They will explore how to take text and convert it into a table as well as converting tables into text. They look at using features like AutoFit and Quick Tables to assist the user in table creations. They demonstrate how to modify the layout of a table with techniques like sorting table data, configuring cell margins and merging cells. They will also talk about how to apply formulas to the data within the table.
episodes.title: Create a Table

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes dive into the creating lists within a Microsoft Word document. They look at how to format a list by adding bullets and show how to customize those bullets. They talk about list indentation and how to modify the line spacing. They demonstrate how to add numbering to a list as well as modifying the numbers that are added to the list.
episodes.title: Create and Modify a List

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes look at how to quickly make modifications to a document by using some of the utilities that are built into Microsoft Word. They demonstrate when and how to use the building block utility. They also talk about how to use some of the prebuilt options inside of the feature called SmartArt.
episodes.title: Insert and Format Building Blocks
